article: My experience as a first year camp instructor held many things I was expecting, but also a number of things I was not expecting.My _ came from lower-income neighborhoods and schools for an 8-week summer day camp.Many of the kids seemed to _ each other before arriving and those who didn't certainly became friends with each other by the second week of camp. During the third week of camp, a new camper _ us.He had just gotten out of year-round school, _ he joined the summer camp a little late.The first week he would _ every morning because he wanted to go home.He complained of not having any _ and he didn't think he would have any fun. One day the following week he didn't _ to camp.Many of the kids had come up to me and asked me _ he was and if he was OK.When I told them he stayed home then and that he didn't think anyone _ him, some of the kids had a _ look on their face because they knew they hadn't made him feel _ Thankfully this camper _ the next day.As he walked over to the area where our group of kids were in the morning times, the entire group stood up and clapped and _ for him.All that day, the kids asked him to _ with them at lunch, be on their teams for games, and stayed in _ with him when we moved to new activities.The.rest of that day, he was happy. I had the pleasure of _ his mother a few days ago, and she gave me the biggest hug and thanked me for helping him to _ .She said, "My son told me that you are the instuctor who's always _ to make him feel welcome, and he knows that you _ care for him.And last week for the first time since he's been here, he didn't call me to pick him up _ from camp.Thank you."
